questions.text: Season three opens on the same scene that season two ended on, only this time the viewer got to see who shot at Nathan Petrelli. Which character was it?
questions.explanation:
Peter Petrelli.

	Peter and Matt were standing next to Nathan as he was about to reveal his powers to the world. From the back of the room shots were fired into Nathan's chest and he went down. The viewer found out that the shooter was a future version of Peter who returned to stop Nathan from revealing his powers, thereby erasing that potential future from existence.

questions.text: Sylar told Claire Bennett that she could never die after cutting off the top of her head and looking at her brain.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Sylar's power was to mimic other's abilities after seeing how they worked. After chasing Claire around through half the episode he finally managed to catch her and look into her brain. After a brief encounter he started to leave without killing her. She asked him why and he told her she could never die, and now neither could he.

questions.text: In the second episode of season 3 Mohinder started to show off powers after he injected himself with a serum in the previous episode. Whose blood was the serum made from?
questions.explanation:
Maya's.

	Mohinder upset Maya then drew blood directly from her adrenal gland. The serum he made from that special blood had the ability to grant powers to the powerless. Soon after injecting himself he started a romantic relationship with Maya, prompting her to tell him that the serum had made him a truly different person.

questions.text: Which character found out he or she was adopted at the beginning of the third episode of season 3?
questions.explanation:
Sylar.

	Sylar, who had killed whom he thought was his other in season one, found out that Angela Petrelli was his actual mother. That made him the half brother to Nathan and Peter and uncle to Claire Bennett.  The revelation was proven to be a lie. Sylar was not related to the Petrelli family.

questions.text: In the fourth episode of the season Peter was jumped four years into the future along with his future self. There he met up with Sylar, who had become a family man. What was Sylar's son's name?
questions.explanation:
Noah.

	Not expressly stated, but it was implied that the boy was named after Noah Bennett. Sylar, going by the name of Gabriel again, had learned to control his ability and was living in the house that Bennett and his family had been in four years prior. During the scene in the future Sylar's son was killed, which caused him to go nuclear and kill more than 200,000 people.

questions.text: Who was the first person Claire hunted down after she decided that she was going to be a crime fighter?
questions.explanation:
Stephen Canfield.

	Canfield had the ability to create miniature black holes. He was an escaped level 5 prisoner of the Company. Claire eventually decided to work with him to attempt to locate the man's family.

questions.text: In the fifth episode of season three, the name of a company set up to compete with "The Company" was finally revealed. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
The Pinehurst Company.

	Blue Sun is from "Firefly", Bad Wolf is from "Doctor Who" and Wayne Enterprises is from "Batman". Officially Pinehurst was a biotechnology company, but unofficially it was the company founded to both hide people with powers and to hunt them down and keep tabs on them. Pinehurst was lead by Arthur Petrelli, by this time in the series "The Company" that had been around from season one was lead by his estranged wife Angela. A name for "The Company" had still not been revealed by the end of season three.

questions.text: In the sixth episode of season three Parkman met up with the woman he had seen in his vision quest. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Daphne.

	Prior to this episode Matt Parkman and Daphne hadn't met other than in flash forward episodes. Parkman told her that they were soulmates and he had seen them married with a child in the future. At first she was skeptical, but after he revealed more details that he otherwise couldn't have known she came around to believe him.

questions.text: How does Maya finally get rid of her powers?
questions.correct: Arthur Petrelli uses his power to remove them
options: A plague removed the abilities from all "evos" in the universe
questions.explanation:
Arthur Petrelli uses his power to remove them.

	Arthur Petrelli was revealed to be alive two episodes prior, when he removed Maya's abilities in the seventh episode of season three. Arthur was the father to Peter and Nathan, who previously had been thought to have committed suicide early in season one.

questions.text: How many years had Arthur and Angela Petrelli been married during the party that Hiro flashed back to?
questions.explanation:
41 years.

	Hiro travelled to Africa during the episode titled "Villains" and went on a vision quest. His vision sent him back 18 months into the past to witness events that lead up to Angela poisoning Arthur and making it look like heart failure. Many key details about characters and how they got to be where they were in the current timeline were revealed. In the end Arthur ended up faking his own death using Angela's poisoning of him as the way to get out of the family and become the "Big Bad" for season three.
